p: Menthol is cyclic terpene alcohol extracted from plant sources that have been used for various medicinal purposes (A Farco & Grundmann, 2013). This bioactive compound is abundant in the essential oil of the peppermint plant. Various scientific studies have shown that menthol has antifungal and antimicrobial activity (Trombetta et al., 2005; Turcheniuk et al., 2015). Researchers have shown that the antimicrobial activity of menthol is probably due to its effects on microbial membrane permeability, which leads to the leakage of intracellular compounds (Kamatou et al., 2013).
